meta.name: description
meta.content: Ewing Marion Kauffman School serves students and is located in Kansas City, MO.

div.div: Both middle school and high school students will continue education through remote learning happening on Chrome Books distributed this March and April. We appreciate parent, student, and staff partnership as we navigate uncharted territory this spring. Please find more updates regarding school closure here.

We've been beaming with joy about the good news seniors Ma'Kahsa and Jackie received recently. Jackie applied early deadline at Kenyon College and was accepted this December with the KEEP scholarship. Ma'Kahsa applied early deadline and was accepted at Macalester College and received the Catharine Lealtad Scholarship.

img.alt: Early Deadline College Acceptance Featured Photo

div.div: We are truly humbled by the reflections of our alumni as they shared the joys, challenges, and moments of growth from their first semester at college during an alumni panel. We are so thankful for the many students who spent time on campus sharing their reflections with both our high school students and our staff!

img.alt: Alumni Return to Kauffman School! Featured Photo

div.div: We loved getting to host Representative Ashley Bland Manlove at Kauffman School in December! We are so grateful to see community leaders come and hear from students, parents and teachers about why public charter school choices matter!

img.alt: Representative Manlove Visits Kauffman Featured Photo

div.div: Congrats to Mr. Velazquez, who was honored in December as the Latinx Education Collaborative Teacher of the Year in Kansas City. And, a huge congrats to Ms. Valderrama for her nomination as well! Our team is continually grateful for the advocacy and commitment to equity & inclusion you model as educators.

img.alt: LatinX Educator of the Year Featured Photo

div.div: Alumni Jacob Esquivel spoke at the Teach For America Shark Tank event about the impact educators have had on his path - proud to see your powerful perspective Jacob!

img.alt: Alumni Speaks at Education Event Featured Photo

div.div: Each season, we host a Senior Night Ceremony to honor the athletes who have showed continued passion and dedication over the years as student athletes. Congrats!

Several Kauffman School students participated in the NextechEd event. Quynton placed 2nd in the NextechEd Micro Drone High School Showcase, the first ever drone race in Kansas City. Students from 7 different schools competed in this race and we are proud that Quyton represented us!

Congratulations to Skye and Miracle for placing 5th and 2nd, respectively, in the Triple Jump at the MSHSAA Class 3 Section 4 Track and Field Championships. They scored 12 points for the Blue Knights, helping Kauffman School beat multiple scoring teams at their first ever sectional championships appearance. Miracle also represented EMKS at the Class 3 Missouri State Championships this spring!

img.alt: Student Athletes Making Waves Featured Photo

div.div: Congrats to our rising seniors who have collectively secured $1 million in college scholarships! Twenty students were awarded a KC Scholars Scholarship worth $50,000. We are proud of our PREPsters!

img.alt: Rising Seniors Secure $1 Million Scholarships Featured Photo

div.div: From India to Tanzania to Ecuador, high school students studied abroad this summer through The Experiment in International Living. The program, which typically lasts about 6 weeks, allows students to live with host families, explore a passion area (like public health), and grow an appreciation of new culture and relationships.

img.alt: Students Explore Through Study Abroad Featured Photo

div.div: Several Kauffman School students have been participating in the Tucker Leadership Lab hosted by William Jewell College. The program encourages students to explore their leadership identity and plan ways to be leaders in the upcoming school year.

div.p: Notice of Non-Discrimination: Ewing Marion Kauffman School, Inc. admits students of any race, color, national origin, ethnic origin, age, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, veteran’s status, disability, or any other legally recognized classification to all the rights, privileges, programs, and activities generally accorded or made available to students at the school. The School does not discriminate, exclude people, or treat them differently on the basis of race, color, national origin, ethnic origin, age, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, veteran’s status, disability, or any other legally recognized classification in administration of its hiring, retention and its other employment policies, educational policies, admission policies, scholarship and loan programs, and athletic and other school-administered programs, and the School provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth programs.

The School complies with the regulations implementing Title VI and Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964; Title IX of the Education Amendments Act of 1972; Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973; the Age Discrimination Act of 1975; and other state and federal laws and regulations.
MOCAP: For more information on the Missouri Course Access Program (MOCAP), see page 73 of our Student and Family Handbook.
